page.title: 17A FARMER'S STORY
page.content:
I usually wake up at 6.00am and have a cup of tea. I have my breakfast of cornflakes and toast, and then I wash up, which I like doing. By 7.00am I am working. I see to the cattle which I am fond of working with. In spring when we're planting I sometimes work till 9.00pm. In autumn I finish earlier, about 4.30pm. Autumn and spring are planting times, and February sees me out in the fields after the winter. In spring and summer I go out to work again even after tea, but I like to come in to watch the news on the television. After I have eaten my dinner, I like to read the newspaper in my spare time. I am fond of dogs. Sometimes I like to go out for a meal. I go in my car, a Ford Escort.
{Continued}
